user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CountSemGetInfo_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_CountSemGetInfo_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, OS_count_sem_prop_t *count_prop)
{
    int                                 sval;
    OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_count_sem_table, *token);

    if (sem_getvalue(&impl->id, &sval) < 0)
    {
        return OS_SEM_FAILURE;
    }

    /* put the info into the structure */
    count_prop->value = sval;
    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_CountSemGetInfo_Impl:
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t OS_impl_count_sem_table[OS_MAX_COUNT_SEMAPHORES]
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
typedef struct
{
    sem_t id;
} OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No use of the Standard Library function memcmp (or any other byte-wise comparison function) appears in the provided code fragments. The function OS_CountSemGetInfo_Impl only calls sem_getvalue, accesses a semaphore id and integer sval, assigns to a numeric field, and returns status codes. The related symbols and types shown (OS_object_token_t, OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t, OS_impl_count_sem_table, OS_ObjectIndexFromToken) do not contain any string handling or memcmp usage. Therefore there are no code locations in the supplied snippets that need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 (memcmp comparing null-terminated strings). If there are other macros or external functions (e.g. the definition of OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET) not provided here, they would need to be reviewed, but based on the supplied code no memcmp-based string comparisons exist.
